author: Doug Bostrom
content:
I guess the local topography and extent of the problem does not permit the use of a barrage that can be raised/lowered as need be.

There’s so much money at stake in your region that I suspect we’ll see a might effort but it’s also the case that the general pool of money for SLR mitigation work will rapidly run out as we’re swamped in multiple locations. We can protect NYC but we can’t simultaneously handle Houston, Miami, LA etc., not if we project “unchecked emissions” which is the empirical record with no significant, plausible sign of change.

So a lot of stuff is going to return to the new nature we’re creating, in our role of playing “big dumb rock from space.” Some form of consolation, for folks interested in more than pavement?

It’s really too bad we’re not better systems thinkers, or much of this could have been avoided. We had a grip on the basics beginning back in the ’70s with the EOS system etc.
